intro: Linum ockendonii, commonly known as the Ockendon flax, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks.
